author: HumanEquivalentUnit
body:
Example of CSV data with three columns, but the last row has data for five columns:

```
PS D:\> @'
>> ID,Animal,Score
>> 1,Dog,85
>> 2,Horse,77
>> 3,Cat,Cow,Llama,53
>> '@ | ConvertFrom-Csv

ID Animal Score
-- ------ -----
1  Dog    85
2  Horse  77
3  Cat    Cow
```

Expected

I think any of these would be reasonable ways to deal with a malformatted file:

 - A terminating exception the whole conversion fails 
 - A non-terminating exception, and the the line is skipped over
 - No exception, the trailing line data after the last expected separator all appears in the last field, in this example `Cow,Llama,53`

Actual behaviour: silently throw data away, with no indication that anything is amiss.

Affects `Import-Csv` as well.

Happens in PSv7 preview and PSv5.1.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
It will easy fix but we need a conclusion before.

What is a behavior of other tools in the case?

comments.author: scotthardwick
comments.body: I had not hit this error before, but certainly powershell should tell us that something is amiss.

title: Import-Csv and ConvertFrom-Csv behave badly on lines with too many separators
